pageContext.surface: covered with patches of iron stains, & very rough.
pageContext.associations: One of 5 objects, 3 were exhibited to S of A, 16 Apl. 1863, by Saml. Wood FSA, & stated to have been found with a large number of bronze objects, most of these were melted. The 5 were No. J40 in the Exhibn. of Shrops. Ant. 1898, & described as "possibly grappling instruments affixed to scaling ladders".
pageContext.publications: Figd. in Proc. Soc. Ant. II (2nd S), p. 252.,S.A.T. X (2nd S), p. 108, & III (3rd S), p. xxii.,Evans B. Impts.p. 43, suggests no purpose for these 5 objects, but calls them "sickle like" p. 43, 405.
pageContext.site: England,Shropshire,Battlefield,hoard found near a hedge when ploughing.
pageContext.toSearch: Battlefield, Shrewsbury, Shropshire Sy1, United Kingdom
